title: How can I reference `torchvision` in sphinx?
body_html:
The objects.inv sphinx inventory for the torch package is hosted at https://pytorch.org/docs/master/objects.inv, so the following works in conf.py:

intersphinx_mapping = {'python': ('https://docs.python.org/', None),
                        'torch': ('https://pytorch.org/docs/master/', None)}

However, a reference such as torchvision.datasets is met with a reference target not found warning by Sphinx. I tried using 'torchvision': ('https://pytorch.org/docs/master/', None) as well, but that didn't help. What must be done?
body_text:
The objects.inv sphinx inventory for the torch package is hosted at https://pytorch.org/docs/master/objects.inv, so the following works in conf.py:
intersphinx_mapping = {'python': ('https://docs.python.org/', None),
                        'torch': ('https://pytorch.org/docs/master/', None)}

However, a reference such as torchvision.datasets is met with a reference target not found warning by Sphinx. I tried using 'torchvision': ('https://pytorch.org/docs/master/', None) as well, but that didn't help. What must be done?
body:
The `objects.inv` sphinx inventory for the `torch` package is hosted at [https://pytorch.org/docs/master/objects.inv](https://pytorch.org/docs/master/objects.inv), so the following works in `conf.py`:
```
intersphinx_mapping = {'python': ('https://docs.python.org/', None),
                        'torch': ('https://pytorch.org/docs/master/', None)}
```
However, a reference such as `torchvision.datasets` is met with a `reference target not found` warning by Sphinx. I tried using `'torchvision': ('https://pytorch.org/docs/master/', None)` as well, but that didn't help. What must be done?
